text:
Random question. Most of the time when you share a link on Twitter it autopopulates the photo from the article, which it isn’t doing for any of our blog posts. Any thoughts on why? Do we need to add a different type of image in there? 

<https://twitter.com/uncorkedstudios/status/788826717624213504>

text: I’m gonna guess that the sharing tag is set to pull the teaser image, and that post does not have a teaser image
Do you see the same behavior for a blog post with a teaser image? , like this one <http://www.uncorkedstudios.com/blog/travel-dossier-nyc-september-2016>

attachments.title: Travel Dossier: NYC September 2016 | Uncorked Studios
attachments.text: A few Uncorkedologists spent last week in New York during UN week, a once-a-year event where heads of state meet for the U.N. General Assembly. When the city is fat with foreign dignitaries, world leaders and media, a whole host of conferences and summits pop-up around the core event, taking advantage of the microcosm of political consciousness and celebrity. Despite the unpleasantries, like horrific traffic, and well, that one bombing incident, it was amazing brain food and we’re proud to have taken part in several events the past few days.
attachments.fallback: Travel Dossier: NYC September 2016 | Uncorked Studios

text: I am trying to add in teaser images on the two latest posts and it says “upload successful” but then doesn’t show up.
